General.Alert:
Unable to locate the LMS's API Implementation.
 Communication with the LMS will not occur.

UIText.InstructionalTextCorrect:
If you exit this course before completion, then continue the course from a different computer, we recommend you re-test your system using this System Checker.

A reliable, high-bandwidth Internet connection is required. Before launching this course be sure to check that the correct course is displayed above. Once in the course, you can close the browser window to save progress for all completed topics and exit. Select Continue to launch the course.
UIText.InstructionalTextFailed:
Your system does not meet the minimum requirements to run this program.

View the table below. Select “More Info” for upgrade information and download links. If the action you take does not require a download and/or restart, select “Retest” when ready.
UIText.InstructionalTextOverridePopup: Warning: This course may not function as intended. Are you sure you wish to continue?

OperatingSystems.Title: Which operating system are you on?
OperatingSystems.Content:
All computers require an operating system to run applications. Examples include Microsoft Windows, Apple Macintosh and UNIX. If you received an alert message, you should switch to a computer that runs Microsoft Windows or Apple Macintosh with a fairly recent version of the operating system installed.

If you require more assistance, right click on your browser and select the 'print' option to print this information, and give it to your system administrator.

Browser.Title: Is your browser up to date?
Browser.Content:
To run our courseware through the Internet, it is best if your computer has an up-to-date version of a web browser. You can try Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, or Safari (Mac only) and see which one gives you the best result. Some courses may work better with a recent version. If required, you can download an upgrade by selecting one of the links provided.

If you require more assistance, right click on your browser and select the 'print' option to print this information, and give it to your system administrator. Some downloads also available at DealerCONNECT/eSupport/Library/Downloads.

JavaScript.Title: How to check and change your JavaScript Settings
JavaScript.Content:
Note To allow scripting on this Web site only, and to leave scripting disabled in the Internet zone, add this Web site to the Trusted sites zone by adding the site: https://fgcg.sabanow.net/Saba/Web/Main

Internet Explorer 8.0 or 9.0 (Windows):

  1. On the Tools menu, click Internet Options, and then click the Security tab.
  2. Click the Internet zone.
  3. If you do not have to customize your Internet security settings, click Default Level. Then do step 4
    • If you have to customize your Internet security settings, follow these steps:
    1. Click Custom Level.
    2. In the Security Settings – Internet Zone dialog box, click Enable for Active Scripting in the Scripting section.
  4. Click the Back button to return to the previous page, and then click the Refresh button to run scripts.

Safari 5.1 for (Mac):

  1. Select Preferences from the Safari menu.
  2. Click Security.
  3. Check Enable JavaScript.
  4. Close the Preferences window.
  5. Click Reload to refresh the content on the page.
If you require more assistance, right click on your browser and select the 'print' option to print this information, and give it to your system administrator.

Cookies.Title: How to enable Cookies?
Cookies.Content:
Blocking all cookies can help protect your privacy, but it might limit your experience on some websites. You can start by blocking all cookies, then allow cookies as needed for websites that you trust. In order for these courses to function properly, we require you enable cookies.

Internet Explorer 8.0 (Windows):

  1. Open Internet Explorer by clicking the Start button , and then clicking Internet Explorer.
  2. Click the Tools button, and then click Internet Options.
  3. Click the Privacy tab, and then, under Settings, move the slider to the bottom to allow all cookies, and then click OK.

Internet Explorer 9.0 for (Windows):

  1. Open Internet Explorer by clicking the Start button . In the search box, type Internet Explorer, and then, in the list of results, click Internet Explorer.
  2. Click the Tools button , and then click Internet options.
  3. Click the Privacy tab, and then, under Settings, move the slider to the bottom to allow all cookies, and then click OK.

Safari 5.1 for (Mac):

  1. In Safari, from the Safari menu, select Preferences.
  2. In the Safari preferences window, click Privacy.
  3. To set your preferences for accepting cookies, next to 'Block cookies:', select from third parties and advertisers, Always, or Never.
  4. If you have any cookies or other web site data stored, click Details. To remove the data from a site, highlight it and click Remove. To remove the data from all sites, click Remove All. When you're finished, click Done to return to the preferences window.
  5. If you require more assistance, right click on your browser and select the 'print' option to print this information, and give it to your system administrator.

Resolution.Title: How to change your screen resolution?
Resolution.Content:
PC with Windows 7:

  1. Open Screen Resolution by clicking the Start button , clicking Control Panel, and then, under Appearance and Personalization, clicking Adjust screen resolution.
  2. Click the drop-down list next to Resolution, move the slider to the resolution you want, and then click Apply.
  3. Click Keep to use the new resolution, or click Revert to go back to the previous resolution.

    Screen Resolution in Control Panel shows the recommended resolution for your monitor.

Mac OS X:

  1. Click on the Apple logo in the upper-left corner of your display.
  2. Click 'System Preferences,' then click 'Displays.'
  3. Click 'Display' if it is not already selected.
  4. Select a resolution from the list of available resolutions. The most common screen resolution is 1280 by 1024 for standard screens and 1280 by 800 for wide screens as of February 2012. Mac OS X immediately applies the new setting.


Read more: How to change a Mac's screen resolution: http://www.macworld.com/article/1158603/macresolution.html

If you require more assistance, right click on your browser and select the 'print' option to print this information, and give it to your system coordinator.

Flash.Title: Is the latest version of Flash installed?
Flash.Content:
Flash is a plug-in that allows multi-media to play through your web browser. The Flash player can be downloaded or upgraded free of charge from Adobe.com, the software company that supports Flash. Simply select the link provided and follow the on-screen instructions.



If you require more assistance, right click on your browser and select the 'print' option to print this information, and give it to your system administrator. Some downloads are also available at DealerCONNECT/eSupport/Library/Downloads.

AdobeReader.Title: Is the latest version of Adobe Reader installed?
AdobeReader.Content:
Adobe Acrobat Reader is a plug-in that allows a PDF file to view through your web browser. The Adobe Acrobat Reader can be downloaded or upgraded free of charge from www.adobe.com. Simply select the link provided and follow the on-screen instructions.



If you require more assistance, right click on your browser and select the 'print' option to print this information, and give it to your system administrator. Some downloads also available at DealerCONNECT/eSupport/Library/Downloads.

Downloading Adobe Reader

Current downloads (supported by DealerCONNECT) can be accessed from the DealerCONNECT portal by clicking on DealerCONNECT eSupport > Library > Downloads.
